subject: Cybersecurity
title: Microsegmentation: Zero Trust at the Network Level
description: A short lesson to help you apply Microsegmentation: Zero Trust at the Network Level.

buildup.text: Microsegmentation applies security policies to individual VMs, containers, or applications rather than network segments.

discovery.text: If one container is compromised, it can't reach any other container. Every communication must be explicitly allowed.

twist.text: Implementing microsegmentation in legacy environments can break applications that assume free internal communication.

climax.text: Microsegmentation is Zero Trust applied at the network layer â€” assume nothing inside is safe, verify everything.

punchline.text: Every workload is an island. No free movement inside.

quiz.question: How does microsegmentation differ from traditional network segmentation?
options: It's the same thing with a different name
It isolates individual workloads rather than network zones, applying per-workload policies
It only works in cloud environments
